title: Safely Utilizing Animal Manure and Compost on Small Produce Farms: a Montana Perspective

tasks.task: Attending a presentation on utilizing animal manures and compost on produce farms.
subtasks: Understanding the role of Montana's cattle industry in producing manure.
Learning about conventional crop and forage ground utilization of manure nutrients.
Recognizing the use of managed compost in crop production.
Considering the benefits and challenges of using manure-based compost on small farms.
Understanding the importance of high tunnels in small-scale vegetable production in Montana.
Addressing social barriers in exchanging nutrients between animal agriculture and produce farms.
Learning about food safety regulations (FSMA) related to manure and compost use.
Implementing storage and handling practices for manure and compost to prevent contamination.
Adapting to organic certification requirements and chemical residue concerns.
Engaging with regulatory and educational resources for best practices.
